title: Prehistoric Painting of India - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Painting - Module 1: Mirzapur, Panchmarhi & Bhimbetka Rock Paintings

questions.question: During which period did early humans start painting and drawing on cave walls?
questions.explanation: Early men started painting and drawing on the walls of caves during the Paleolithic era, some 40,000 years ago.

questions.question: How many years ago was the Mesolithic period from the present time?
questions.explanation: Many paintings were found from the Mesolithic period, around 12,000 years ago from the present time.

questions.question: Where are the Mirzapur rock paintings located?
options: In caves at Kaimur hills in the valley of Son river
questions.explanation: There are some caves at Kaimur hills in the valley of Son river, just 20 kms from Mirzapur town where rock paintings are found.

questions.question: What are the names of the caves in Mirzapur?
questions.explanation: These caves in Mirzapur are known as Likhunia, Bhaldaria etc.

questions.question: How many rock shelters are embellished with rock art at Mirzapur?
questions.explanation: There are at least 250 rock shelters, which are embellished with rock art on various themes at Mirzapur.

questions.question: What is the medium used in 'Primitive Hunters' painting?
questions.explanation: The medium of Primitive Hunters painting is earth and mineral colours.

questions.question: The 'Primitive Hunters' painting approximately dates to which period?
questions.explanation: The Primitive Hunters painting dates approximately to 5000 BC.

questions.question: What is shown in the 'Primitive Hunters' painting?
options: A man with a lance riding a horse and chasing a tiger
questions.explanation: In this painting, a man with a lance is shown riding a horse. He is chasing a tiger.

questions.question: What was the most popular subject for prehistoric cave painters?
questions.explanation: Primitive hunters seemed to be the most popular subject for these painters.

questions.question: Which colours of pigments are used in Mirzapur rock paintings?
questions.explanation: In some cases, they have used red, black and yellow pigments in the paintings.

questions.question: How do the animals appear in comparison to human figures in prehistoric paintings?
options: Animals appear much more completely rendered
questions.explanation: The animals appear to be much more completely rendered than the human figures.

questions.question: In which state are Panchmarhi hills situated?
questions.explanation: Panchmarhi hills are situated in the state of Madhya Pradesh.

questions.question: What does 'Panchmarhi' mean according to popular belief?
questions.explanation: By popular belief, the name 'Pachmarhi' is derived from 'Panch-Marhi' or complex of five caves.

questions.question: Which legendary figures are supposed to have spent time in Panchmarhi caves?
questions.explanation: The five Pandavas are supposed to have spent some time in these caves.

questions.question: What does the 'Rows of Cows' painting from Panchmarhi show?
options: A cowherd driving a herd of cows to the pasture
questions.explanation: 'Rows of Cows' shows a cowherd driving a herd of cows to the pasture.

questions.question: What colours are used in the 'Rows of Cows' painting?
options: Ochre (Geru) red in the background and white for the figures
questions.explanation: The colours are limited to Ochre (Geru) red in the background and white for the figures.

questions.question: The drawing of cows in 'Rows of Cows' is described as:
questions.explanation: The stylized drawing of the cows is almost geometrical, yet it shows a lot of movement both in the animal and human figures.

questions.question: Where is Bhimbetka located?
questions.explanation: Bhimbetka is situated near Bhopal in Madhya Pradesh.

questions.question: How many rock shelter caves are there at Bhimbetka?
questions.explanation: There are more than 754 rock shelter caves at Bhimbetka.

questions.question: To which period do the Bhimbetka rock paintings belong?
questions.explanation: The rock paintings belong to the Mesolithic period of hunter-gatherers.

questions.question: What is the main theme portrayed in Bhimbetka paintings?
options: Man and his relationship with animals
questions.explanation: The painter portrayed man and his relationship with animals.

questions.question: Which animals are shown in the 'Fighters' painting from Bhimbetka?
options: Bulls, bisons, elephants, wild boars etc.
questions.explanation: The human figures are shown with different kinds of animals like bulls, bisons, elephants, wild boars etc.

questions.question: What are human figures holding in the 'Fighters' painting?
questions.explanation: All the human figures hold many types of primitive weapons.

questions.question: How many men are shown attacking different animals in the 'Fighters' painting?
questions.explanation: The painting shows four men attacking different animals.

questions.question: What interesting weapon appears in Bhimbetka paintings that was not found in earlier periods?
questions.explanation: The appearance of the bow is also very interesting as it was not found in the earlier period.

questions.question: Which modern tribal painters still execute paintings similar to prehistoric art?
questions.explanation: Paintings like these are still executed by the Warli painters of Maharashtra.

questions.question: What style are the forms in the 'Fighters' painting described as?
questions.explanation: The silhouette forms of figures are full of action.

questions.question: What does the term 'Paleolithic' mean?
questions.explanation: Paleolithic means Early Stone Age.

questions.question: What does the term 'Mesolithic' mean?
questions.explanation: Mesolithic means Middle Stone Age.

questions.question: What does the term 'Neolithic' mean?
questions.explanation: Neolithic means New Stone Age.

questions.question: How are mineral colours obtained?
questions.explanation: Mineral colours are obtained from stones (minerals).

questions.question: What is a silhouette?
options: A dark image outlined against a light background
questions.explanation: Silhouette is a dark image outlined against a light background.

questions.question: What is rock engraving?
options: The surface is carved into to get forms
questions.explanation: Rock engraving is when the surface is carved into to get forms.

questions.question: What is rock brushing?
options: Fat or other sticky things are brushed on the surface, after that powder colours are painted on it
questions.explanation: Rock brushing is when fat or other sticky things are brushed on the surface, after that powder colours are painted on it.

questions.question: Why did early humans paint animals in caves?
options: As a representation of their practical life experiences and hunting
questions.explanation: The hunting scene in the painting is a representation of their practical life experiences. Primitive men used to hunt large and dangerous animals in groups.

questions.question: What types of animals are shown in Mirzapur rock paintings?
options: Both domestic and wild animals like elephants, boars, tigers
questions.explanation: The paintings show many species of animals, like elephants, boars and even tigers. Domestic animals were also painted, along with wild animals.

questions.question: What is the earliest discovery period of Prehistoric art in India?
questions.explanation: That period (Mesolithic, around 12000 years ago) was the earliest discovery of Prehistoric art in India.

questions.question: In prehistoric paintings, what quality do the works of art show?
questions.explanation: The effectiveness of works of art of the individual forms is a result of qualities of clarity and balance.

questions.question: Are the forms in Panchmarhi paintings primarily decorative?
options: No, they are not primarily decorative
questions.explanation: In many of the paintings, forms on the wall are arranged in seemingly haphazard order. They are not primarily decorative.

questions.question: What did early humans use stone for during the Paleolithic period?
options: Hunting birds and wild animals to save their lives
questions.explanation: In the Paleolithic period, early humans lived in caves and used stone for hunting birds and wild animals to save their lives.

questions.question: What activity are the primitive men shown doing in groups in the paintings?
options: Chasing animals, surrounding them, and killing them with primitive weapons
questions.explanation: The painting also shows a group of people chasing the animals, surrounding them, and killing them with their primitive weapons.

questions.question: What animals are the men taming in the 'Fighters' painting?
questions.explanation: They are also taming a horse in the painting.

questions.question: How are the human and animal forms compared in Bhimbetka paintings?
options: It is interesting to compare them from the point of view of completeness with which they are suggested by artistic conventions
questions.explanation: It is interesting to compare the human and animal forms from the point of view of the completeness with which they are suggested by the artistic conventions.

questions.question: Where did early humans live during the Paleolithic period?
questions.explanation: In the Paleolithic period, early humans lived in caves.

questions.question: What is the approximate date range for when early humans started cave painting?
questions.explanation: Early men started painting and drawing on the walls of caves during the Paleolithic era, some 40,000 years ago.
